rev.comment: adjusted lead as per comment on talk page. The article is about the ideology, not about "a term".
/* Other variations and subforms */ Austofascism is a variation. early on Dolufuss especially was linked with Mussolini and both opposed early national socialism in favour of trad fascism.
/* Neo-fascism */ neo-fascism isn't a specific subform of fascism, its an ambigious term allies to numerous, very different movements, non in power
/* Political spectrum */ Walter Laqueur has an article, correct name spelling
/* Early Falangism */ link to Kataeb Party of Lebanon
I don't know why bobisbob removed a huge chunk of the most definative and original form of fascism. this needs full presenation
rm at least some degree of
corporatism is an integral and important part of fascism

enough, they did not oppsoe general captialism
Change section "Falangism" to "Early Falangism". After coopting by Franco and consolidation w/ Carlism party moved from fascism to Franquism
if we are going to say it opposed socialism, saying that it also opposed capitalism is mandatory
again it did not object to capitalism in general
it did not object to general capitalism
/* Para-Fascism or the Radical Right */ Parafascism shouldn't actually be under "variants and subform" but in a section distinguished from generic fascism.

/* Other variations and subforms */ Move 4th Aug under Para-fascism (see Fascism Reader p313). Falange move away from Fascism - Franco and Franco's Spain not fascist, cites.
/* Other variations and subforms */ Move Estado Novo & Austrofascism under subheading Para-Fascism. See Fascism Reader p313 cited under Estado Novo
